hasAttributes.name: departmentCode
hasAttributes.description: Code for department rosters. EXAMPLE the department name is IT department, the code is 0018

hasAttributes.name: employeeDateOfBirth
hasAttributes.description: Date of Birth of the employee

hasAttributes.name: employeeId
hasAttributes.description: Unique identifier for an employee. Typically auto-generated by the system

hasAttributes.name: employeeJobTitle
hasAttributes.description: Job title of a person in an accounting unit. EXAMPLE Accounting manger

hasAttributes.name: employeeRefCode
hasAttributes.description: Code for employee. Each employee has only one code. If someone has part-time jobs in multiple departments, there will be more than one record with different Employee_ID in this table. The part-time status will be reflected in EmployeeTypeCode

hasAttributes.name: employmentStartDate
hasAttributes.description: Employment start date of the employee

hasAttributes.name: employmentTerminationDate
hasAttributes.description: Termination date of the employee from when the labour contract was no longer valid, or from when the employee no longer works in this department

hasAttributes.name: employmentTypeCode
hasAttributes.description: Code for the employee type. EXAMPLE 004 is an on-the-job employee, 005 is a retired employee 006 is a deceased employee.

hasAttributes.name: employmentTypeName
hasAttributes.description: Name of the employee type. Example Employed, retired, probation, part time.

hasAttributes.name: isActiveFlag
hasAttributes.description: Indicates whether one employee is active or inactive. An employee can become inactive due to various reasons (i.e sabbatical leave)

hasAttributes.name: userId
hasAttributes.description: A unique identifier of individuals entering transactions into the ERP system. This field is used to join information in this table to other tables based on the fields Entered_By, Last_Modified_By, and Approved_By.
